lines.text: A whim, thought, and more is sought. Awake, my mind; thy will be wrought!
Sheathe these feet in the driving gale. Make swift these legs; o'er land I sail!
Three suns aligned, pour forth their might, and fill the archer's bow with might!
The arrows turn, the swords rebel; may nothing pierce this mortal shell!
Whispered sscrets of a shattered age, I summon you; renew this sage!
By nature's hand, by craft, by art, what once was one, now fly apart!
O mist-filled pits dark, dank, unclear, touch all before me with frost-fingered fear!
By what creeps, what crawls, by what does not, let all that grows recede and rot!
Power of rot, obscuring truth, what once was old restore to youth!
